728449f-a.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Rossville Avenue
728449f-a.text:
Arthur Kill Road, at the head of Rossville Avenue. Robinson's
1907 map and Bromley's 1917 map show the house to be on the A. Winant
property.
April 22, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
728449f-a.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Rossville Avenue, Staten Island, NY

728372f-b.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Rossville Avenue
728372f-b.text:
(1)
2298 Arthur Kill Road, south side, east of Rossville Avenu
The house belonged to George Oakley (1874 and 1898), and later
(1907 and 1917), to Virginia Cutting. The dates refer to maps on
which the owners'names App6ar.
Aril 29, 1932.
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same, five years later.
May 3, 1937.
P.L. Sperr
(3)
Another view of the house at a still later date.
April 22, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
728372f-b.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Rossville Avenue, Staten Island, NY

728373f-b.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Rossville Avenue
728373f-b.text:
2340 Arthur Kill Road, at the S. W. corner of
Rossville Avenue, showing Court Rossville, Foresters of
America. The house was owned by J.W. Miller in 1874; by
Henry Winant in 1898 and by H.R. Winants in 1907. Dates
refer to maps on which the owners' names appear. View 2
shows the rear of the house, viewing north on Rossville
Avenue from Hook Avenue.
Views 1, 2: April 20, 1929
View 3: September 7, 1936
P. L. Sperr
728373f-b.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Rossville Avenue, Staten Island, NY

728448f-a.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Rossville Avenue
728448f-a.text:
Arthur Eill Road, south side, east of Rossville Avenue,
adjoining on the east the house bearing No. 2298, showing a
group of willow trees.
April 29, 1932.
P. L. Sperr
(s)
The willow samp at Arthur Kill Road and Rossville
Avenue, several years later.
May 3, 1937
P. L. Sperr
